comments.author: stefanh@inbox.com
comments.text: *** Bug 633706 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
comments.creator: stefanh@inbox.com

comments.author: stefanh@inbox.com
comments.raw_text:
From bug 633706, comment #0:
---------------------------------
Ref: Bug 628918 - Make CTRL-F4 work in tabbmail (but not in OSX) and better
keyboard tab navigation on Mac.

Changes:
1. CTRL-F4 works in tabbmail except in OSX.

2. for OS X Added. ⌘+{ and ⌘+} on US keyboards, as keyboard shortcuts for
switching tabs.
---------------------------------

Also: Ctrl+Tab shortcut to navigate browser/mail tabs on Mac. Ctrl+Tab no longer works when navigating frames on Mac.
comments.creator: stefanh@inbox.com
comments.text:
From bug 633706, comment #0:
---------------------------------
Ref: Bug 628918 - Make CTRL-F4 work in tabbmail (but not in OSX) and better
keyboard tab navigation on Mac.

Changes:
1. CTRL-F4 works in tabbmail except in OSX.

2. for OS X Added. ⌘+{ and ⌘+} on US keyboards, as keyboard shortcuts for
switching tabs.
---------------------------------

Also: Ctrl+Tab shortcut to navigate browser/mail tabs on Mac. Ctrl+Tab no longer works when navigating frames on Mac.
Hmm, should be add a "Tab navigation" section and list all shortcuts there (mailNews, browser, "normal" tabs)?
comments.raw_text: Hmm, should be add a "Tab navigation" section and list all shortcuts there (mailNews, browser, "normal" tabs)?
comments.creator: stefanh@inbox.com
comments.author: stefanh@inbox.com

comments.text:
(In reply to comment #3)
> Hmm, should be add a "Tab navigation" section and list all shortcuts there

Hmm, we already have "Tabbed Browsing Shortcuts". Maybe you want to rename it, depending on what you're trying to achieve. Can you elaborate?

> (mailNews, browser, "normal" tabs)?

What are "normal" tabs?
